medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain, nausea, and vomiting for the past 2 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 2 days ago after the patient underwent a laparoscopic cholecystectomy. Initially, the patient did well post-operatively with no abdominal pain, nausea, or vomiting. After starting a more aggressive bowel regimen, she had a bowel movement but subsequently developed epigastric and RUQ abdominal pain, along with nausea and vomiting. Emesis is non-bloody and non-bilious. The patient reports poor appetite and has had liquids but no solid food. No fevers or chills are present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of gallbladder polyps diagnosed via imaging, history of biliary colic.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had adenocarcinoma of the spine/pelvis; uncle had hypertension; aunts had hypertension.
